results.title: [Maurie Fields and Val Jellay Home Movies: Reel 20]
results.brief_description:
This film is a vignette of family life in the suburbs, including a backyard barbeque and a trip to the Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show. There are good examples of men’s, women’s and children’s fashion of the 1960s. This glimpse of the Royal Melbourne Show is a nostalgic journey back in time.

The title on the film can indicates that it is 1966 and Joy’s party.

We see a backyard gathering with adults and children. It is possibly a birthday party. Maurie drinks beer and poses for the camera. He and Val share a kiss and tend to the barbeque. To the amusement of others, one party goer bursts into a spontaneous dance sequence. In the background we see a Hills Hoist clothes line and what could possibly be an outhouse, or outdoor toilet. Handwritten humorous signs are displayed in various locations around the backyard. One sign reads “To Be Seen Stand Up, To be Heard Speak Up, To be Appreciated, Shut Up”.

There is a trip to the Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show. The film shows signage for Peter’s Ice Cream, Coca-Cola and Four N Twenty Snack Bar. A man on stilts walks in front of the Four N Twenty Snack Bar sign. The children eat toffee apples and explore the sights, including the entrance to the animal pavilion at the show.

The film finishes with images of signs advertising Ross Wylie, Graham Chapman and Mike Furber, who were a part of the popular music scene in Australia at the time. There is also a graphic sign which reads “the Up and Coming of Stage Radio, Stars of Sunshine Records”.

Originally made on 8mm film.

results.title: [Mr. Corbett's holiday]
results.creator_credit: David Lee, Protector International, Qantas Airways and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Mr Henry J. Corbett arrives on a trip to Australia. Through his trip we are shown all the marvelous range of safety industrial gear made by Protector International. This films is basically a marketing tool for Protector and QANTAS.

results.title: [Maurie Fields and Val Jellay Home Movies: Reel 17]
results.brief_description:
This film is a vignette of suburban family life and recreation.

Some sections of this film are underexposed and a hair in the gate appears throughout.

The film opens with scenes of a rugby Union football match which could possibly be an inter-school sports match.

On a suburban street we see a group of teenage boys riding bicycles past parked cars which include a Buick, a Toyota Corolla and a Datsun 180B hitched up to a trailer.

The cyclists accompany the Datsun as it is driven along a Melbourne street past traffic lights, a Clearway sign and a Mobil petrol station.

Inside a weatherboard house, a white cat resides. The human incumbents mug for the camera. Marty (Maurie and Val’s son) pulls faces and tumbles about in slapstick prattfalls. He performs a Fireman carry on a damsel in distress. Playfully, he perches Val Jellay on his lap.

Originally made on 8mm film.

results.title: [Maurie Fields and Val Jellay Home Movies: Reel 18]
results.brief_description:
This film is a vignette of family life played out in the suburbs and on holiday in the Narrabeen Lakes, New South Wales. The title on the film reel indicates that some of the footage is filmed around Christmas time and at Narrabeen Lakes.

The film opens with scenes of a primary school playground. Children line up outside for roll call and morning announcements. Teachers organise the formation of groups and lead their charges into the school building.

In a suburban backyard we see a young swashbuckling pyjama-clad pirate, possibly showing off his recent Christmas presents. With a passionfruit vine for an audience, he demonstrates his swordsmanship and fancy footwork around the Hills Hoist clothes line.

Maurie blows up an inflatable wading pool which is filled with water for the children to play in.

The adults imbibe in convivial Christmas drinks, with one of the cohort entering into the spirit of the pirate theme, brandishing a dagger and wearing a pirate hat in a jaunty fashion.

A family road trip takes us across a bridge to what could be the Narrabeen lakes area, Sydney’s Northern Beaches largest estuary system.

On and beside the lake we see some water ski action, water ski hire facilities, and an EJ Holden parked on the side of the road.

A cliff top walk reveals ocean views and an Austin Cambridge car (c. 1965) parked beside a view point.

Originally made on 8mm film.

results.title: [Maurie Fields and Val Jellay Home Movies: Reel 19]
results.brief_description:
This film shows suburban street scenes, a trip to the country and a visit to an animal shelter. There are good examples of 1960s fashion, suburban architecture and cars reflective of the era.

The film opens with Maurie and friends playfully posing with each other and performing for the camera in a tree-lined suburban street, possibly in Albert Park.

The friends all get into a Morris Major Elite (1962-1964) waving as they drive down the street past a Chrysler AP2 Royal (1958-1961). Single-story terrace houses can be seen in the background.

The family makes a stop-over at a cat and kitten shelter. A handwritten sign scrawled across the side of the building reads: “All cats and kittens in the hostel are stray and unwanted. Their health cannot be guaranteed. Please consult your vet and have your cat immunised immediately”. Beside the writing there is another sign reading “Kindly give a donation thank you”. Val plays with a kitten and presumably adopts it as she carries it into their car.

Families enjoy a couple of trips to the country, including a picnic under pine trees. A small boy attempts to climb one of the trees with hands-on assistance from Maurie. Val swings from a branch, flailing her legs comically. Lunch is cooked on a portable tripod-style wood-fuelled barbeque, while people sit in plastic banana lounges and picnic chairs. There is general banter and typical outdoor revelry among the friends. A large, non-functioning steam train serves as an improvised playground for the children.

Originally made on 8mm film.

results.title: [Kirsty Sword Gusmao Film Collection: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
Titled The Stars Were. This film shows closeups of the children who starred in “Walking to School” and “The Bear”.

The film then moves on to show a tractor dragging flames to set fire to a dry paddock. We see various farm scenery including sheep, burning off, horse riding and a tractor ploughing a field.

The film then shows a narrative short story titled “The Wish Wizard” which could be an Eaglehawk Primary school production. This film shows school children discovering a book which contains a map to “The Olde Wishing Well”. They gather together and conjure up a wizard using a magic spell. We see good close ups of children’s faces as they interact with the wizard.

We then see a school boy walking and running down a country road where he discovers animal tracks in the dirt and encounters a woman wearing a red coat carrying apples in a basket.

This film shows good examples of school fashion, children’s faces and farming practices.

Selected highlights (timecodes from Access Overscan)
00:00:49:00 - Title card Story ‘The Bear’
00:01:05:00 - Burning off with tractor
00:02:56:00 - Title card ‘the wish wizard’

results.title: [Kirsty Sword Gusmao Film Collection: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
Titled Walking to School.
This could possibly be an Eaglehawk Primary School Production.

This narrative film follows the eventful journey of a young school boy as he walks to school along a country road. On the way he is joined by school friends and we see their encounters with a variety of native Australian Wildlife. They see lace monitor tracks and follow them to where the monitor is scaling a tree. They also find a possum and an echidna. The film shows various closeups of the animals and the children’s faces as they squint and shield their eyes from the sun.

The children cross a wooden bridge where they meet an old man carrying a swag and a billy. The man gathers the children around him and reads a story to them called “The Bear”. The film then shows us the story as it is being told. It is a tale of a young girl who is very poor, very dirty and very sad. One day she finds a toy koala which brings her great joy. Excitedly she tries to show her Koala to other school children who are playing games in the school yard. They ridicule her and throw sticks at her. She runs away and falls on the grass where she drifts off to sleep. She dreams that she is rescued by a fairy Godmother who transforms her into a very clean girl in a beautiful dress! During this sequence we see good examples of Super 8 “special effects” as the fairy works her magic on the other children, transforming them into characters in fancy dress. We see these children playing circle games and closeups of their faces. Eventually the poor girl wakes up to find a kind school boy standing over her. He helps her to her feet, takes her hand and leads her to join his other friends. Together the group skip happily all the way to school along a country road.

This film shows good examples of children’s fashion, games and faces. We also see footage of houses and streets of the time.

Selected Highlights (timecodes from Access Overscan)
00:00:06:00 Title card ‘Walking to School’
00:00:30:00 Goanna climbing tree
00:02:23:00 Echidna
00:03:45:00 Kids story time reading from ‘The Bear’

results.title: [Kirsty Sword Gusmão Film Collection]
results.material_description:
30 x reels 8mm film
Super 8mm and regular 8mm film collection, anotated list of content provided by donor see documents references window.
results.brief_description:
Kirsty Sword Gusmao AO is and Australian-East Timorese activist who served as the First Lady of East Timor from 2002 until 2007. She was married to Xanana Gusmao, Prime Minister and former President of Timor-Leste, now residing in Coburg, Melbourne. A collection of 8mm home movies including:
Sword family life, including holidays in the 1970s
Fictional student films from Eaglehawk Primary, north of Bendigo
Melbourne scenes inlcuding Tullamarine Airport
School camp
Bendigo Show
Hanging Rock excursion
Moonee Ponds
Indonesia - Denpasar
Fellowship trip to the USA

results.title: [Kirsty Sword Gusmao Film Collection: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This film shows a slice of life from a working dairy farm in central Gippsland, Victoria.

We see cows being milked, the milk cans being loaded onto trucks and in to the trays of utility cars. The milk is transported by road to the Maffra Co-operative Milk Products Company.

There are scenes of hay bales being driven around the paddocks in the back of a ute. The hay is divided in to sections and fed to the cattle. We see de-horned Jersey and Friesian cows and bulls eating the hay and children riding a WX 572 tractor.

There is footage of a newly born calf being licked clean by its mother and we see the calf’s first attempt to stand and take its first steps.

The film also shows a family visit to the Glenmaggie Dam Enlargement Project Observation Point.

Selected sequence list (timecodes from Access Overscan)
00:00:54:00 The Maffra Co-operative Milk Products Co LTD sign
00:02:12:00 Title card ‘A Calf is Born’
00:03:55:00 Dad and kids riding a tractor
00:04:00:00 Title card ‘Wattle Time’
00:04:38:00 Glenmaggie Dam Enlargement Project Observation Point
results.description:
This film shows a slice of life from a working dairy farm in central Gippsland, Victoria.

We see cows being milked, the milk cans being loaded onto trucks and in to the trays of utility cars. The milk is transported by road to the Maffra Co-operative Milk Products Company.

There are scenes of hay bales being driven around the paddocks in the back of a ute. The hay is divided in to sections and fed to the cattle. We see de-horned Jersey and Friesian cows and bulls eating the hay and children riding a WX 572 tractor.

There is footage of a newly born calf being licked clean by its mother and we see the calf’s first attempt to stand and take its first steps.

The film also shows a family visit to the Glenmaggie Dam Enlargement Project Observation Point.

Selected sequence list (timecodes from Access Overscan)
00:00:54:00 The Maffra Co-operative Milk Products Co LTD sign
00:02:12:00 Title card ‘A Calf is Born’
00:03:55:00 Dad and kids riding a tractor
00:04:00:00 Title card ‘Wattle Time’
00:04:38:00 Glenmaggie Dam Enlargement Project Observation Point

results.title: [Korean artist] (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Begins with a resume of ancient Korean art. Then introduces the work of Lee Hyung Pyo, a contemporary Korean painter. Lee’s continuing artistic problem is to find a way of bridging the distance between the traditional culture into which he was born and the inescapable influences of the present.
